definition: misfortune/crisis/grave danger/critical situation/disaster/emergency/to be zealous in helping others out of a predicament

sentences.english: Then they cried to the Lord in anguish, and he rescued them from their distress.
sentences.chinese: 他們於急難中一哀求上主，上主即拯救他們脫離困苦。

sentences.english: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 就是在急難時我嘴脣所發的，口中所許的。

sentences.english: The insurance period of AXA assistance service should be consist with this policy.
sentences.chinese: 海外急難援助服務與本保險起止日期一致。

sentences.english: In his time of trouble King Ahaz became even more unfaithful to the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 這亞哈斯王在急難的時候，越發得罪耶和華。

sentences.english: The system of temporary rescue shall be comprehensively implemented to provide timely help to those in urgent needs.
sentences.chinese: 全面實施臨時救助制度，全面推開“救急難”工作。

sentences.english: Why do you come to me now, when you're in trouble?
sentences.chinese: 現在你們遭遇急難爲何到我這裏來呢？

sentences.english: 14 vows my lips promised and my mouth spoke when I was in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 就是在急難時我嘴脣所發的，口中所許的。

sentences.english: and why are ye come unto me now when ye are in distress?
sentences.chinese: 現在你們遭遇急難爲何到我這裏來呢。

sentences.english: I often told her the story all of mine when I was in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我經常告訴她我的所有的故事，就是在急難的時候。

sentences.english: Insured shall be obliged to use reasonable efforts to mitigate the effects of an emergency.
sentences.chinese: 被保險人應盡其最大努力減輕急難狀況之影響。

sentences.english: You are more likely to receive assitance from someone you do not know just about anywhere else in world.
sentences.chinese: 你是更容易收到急難的人你不知道一個地方在世界。

sentences.english: There are tea wine more brothers, trouble ever see a man.
sentences.chinese: 有茶有酒多兄弟，急難何曾見一人。

sentences.english: All her pursuers have overtaken her In the midst of distress.
sentences.chinese: 在急難中，一切追逼她的人將她追上了。

definition: to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
